text: Epoxy/resinous floor system type (self-leveling, flake, quartz, urethane) matches approved submittals
Coating thickness and system components (primer, base coat, broadcast media, topcoat) confirmed
Material stored per manufacturer guidelines (temperature, humidity, shelf life)
SDS, VOC data, and finish samples submitted and approved
Substrate dry, clean, free from curing compound, sealers, or laitance
Moisture test (ASTM F2170 or F1869) conducted and passed
Surface prep performed (shot blast, grind, scarify) to meet CSP level per spec (e.g., CSP 3–5)
Repairs to cracks, divots, joints, and edges completed
Primer coat applied and allowed proper cure
Base coat applied evenly at specified thickness (in mils or mm)
Aggregate/flakes/quartz broadcast uniformly if system requires
Topcoat applied at specified DFT (dry film thickness) and spread rate
Cove base or vertical upturns installed (if applicable)
Surface texture, color, sheen, and gloss consistent throughout
No pinholes, bubbles, fisheyes, or delamination
Slip resistance tested and meets project criteria (ASTM D2047 / ANSI A137.1)
Coating cure complete before traffic allowed
Closeout documents submitted (maintenance manual, warranty, installer certification)

id: • ASTM F3010 / F1869 / F2170 / D2047, ACI 515.2, LEED VOC
• Manufacturer Specs: Sika, Tnemec, Stonhard, Dur-A-Flex, Flowcrete, Sherwin-Williams
• Slab prep guide per ICRI CSP standards (Concrete Surface Profile)
